Event.name: Imitating
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> displays a <fen>Characteristic</fen> of a <fen>Standard</fen> in his or her own way of behaving.
<ex>I guessed <fex name="agt">he</fex> was trying to <t>imitate</t> <fex name="Characteristic">the movements of a skier</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Containing_event">In a tv commercial last year</fex>, <fex name="Agent">she</fex> <t>aped</t> <fex name="Characteristic">male slobbiness</fex> <fex name="Depictive">in a singlet and Y-front-style underpants, kicking back on the couch, watching sport</fex>.</ex>
<ex>'You are all the same ,' <fex name="agt">he</fex> said, <t>imitating</t> <fex name="Characteristic">not her voice but its angry cadence</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Antony, after he had seen this man, <t>imitated</t> <fex name="Standard">him</fex> <fex name="Characteristic">in piety</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person that borrows a <fen>Characteristic</fen> behavior from a <fen>Standard</fen>.
<ex>Mimic Snotlings do n't really think for themselves, <fex name="agt">they</fex> merely <t>mimic</t> the actions of Orcs and Goblins around them.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Characteristic
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Characteristic</fen> is a behavior or property that the <fen>Standard</fen> possesses and which the <fen>Agent</fen> adopts in his or her own behavior.
<ex>They were all <t>mimicking</t> <fex name="Characteristic">my accent</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (<ment>eagerly</ment>, <ment>carefully</ment>).
<ex>She <t>mimicked</t> him <fex name="Manr">carefully</fex> as he moved, her movements naturally graceful.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An act performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the imitation.
<ex>Alhough proud of their strong balance sheets , most European superbanks have yet to <t>imitate</t> the Japanese <fex name="Means">by lending aggressively abroad</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Standard
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Standard</fen> is the entity that exhibits a certain <fen>Characteristic</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> models their own behavior on.
<ex>The singer says Gwen has <t>copied</t> <fex name="Standard">her</fex> in many different ways.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Agent</fen> intends to accomplish by performing the imitation.
<ex>Kashi's soul remembered all the characteristics of Kashi, the boy, and therefore <t>mimicked</t> his hoarse voice <fex name="Purpose">in order to stir my recognition</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the imitation event logically follows. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the imitating event as being in some state. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the imitating event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the imitation event occurs and of which the imitating event is taken to be a part.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Agent</fen>'s way of behaving is similar to that of the <fen>Standard</fen>.
<ex>Kurt Cobain <t>aped</t> him <fex name="Degree">to perfection</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time at which the imitation occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> imitates some entity which acts as a <fen>Standard</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: imitate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to behave in a way characteristic of

lexUnit.name: mimic.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: imitate in order to entertain or ridicule.

lexUnit.name: ape.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: imitate, especially in an absurd or unthinking way.

lexUnit.name: copy.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: imitate the behaviour or style of.
